name: libr-bridge/R.mjs
R
description: Class for accessing R via libR.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for class R

name: __initializeRfunc
description:
Load some R functions.
Please do not call manually.

name: isInitialized
description: Check whether R class is globally initialized or not.

return.description: Returns true if R is already loaded.

name: GlobalEnv
description: Aquire global environment in R.

name: libR
description: Initialized libR object for accessing R.

name: func
description:
Acquire bridging function to access R function.
Functions receive JavaScript value, and returns JavaScript compatible objects.

name: func_raw
description:
Acquire bridging function to access R function.
This function doesn't convert to/from SEXP.
Receives SEXPWrap, and returns SEXPWrap. Please use carefully.

name: __func_sexp
description:
Find functions in R environment.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: __RFuncBridge_raw
description:
Bridging function for R function.
This bridging function doesn't handle SEXP.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: __RFuncBridge
description:
Bridging function for R function.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: eval_raw
description: Execute R code.

return.description: SEXPWrap object of returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: __eval_langsxp
description: Execute R code with LANGSXP

name: eval_direct
description:
Execute R code without error handling. App crashes when execution/parse failure.
Please use this function with care.

return.description: SEXPWrap object of returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: eval
description: Execute R code.
examples: let value = R.eval("sum(c(1, 2, 3))")		// value will be 6

return.description: JavaScript compatible object of returned value.

name: evalWithTry
description: Execute R code with R try. This is more safe than {@link R#eval}.

return.description: Returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: getVar
description: Acquire value of R variable

name: getVarNames
description: Acquire names attribute of R variable

return.description: Associated name attribute for the specified R variable. If no name, undefined will be returned.

name: setVar
description: Set value to R variable

params.name: value
params.description: Value you want to set to variable.

name: setVarNames
description: Set names attribute to R variable

params.name: value
params.description: Value you want to set to names attributes

name: release
description: Finish using R.

name: range
description:
Python like range function.
Be careful, this is not R ':' operator
range(0, 3) == [0, 1, 2], which is not eq. to 0:3

return.description: value in a <= x < b. range(0, 3) == [0, 1, 2]

name: libr-bridge/RObject.mjs
libr-bridge/SEXPWrap.mjs
__initializeWithValue
description: Initialize this instance with specified value.

name: protect
description: Protect this SEXP

name: unprotect
description: Unprotect SEXPs

name: preserve
description: Preserve this SEXP. Please use protect() if you can.

name: release
description: Release preserved SEXP. protect()ed SEXP should be releaseed with unprotect()

name: isList
description: Return true if this SEXP is List.

name: isVector
description: Return true if this SEXP is Vector. Please note single scalar value in R is vector.

name: length
description: Return the length of vector.

name: isNull
description: Return true if this SEXP is null.

name: SEXPSize
description: Return sizeof(SEXP) in byte.

name: libr-bridge/develop.mjs
libr-bridge/example.mjs
libr-bridge/index.mjs
content:
import R from './R'
export default R

name: libr-bridge/libR.mjs
SEXPTYPE
description: R SEXP type enums

types: {"NILSXP": *, "SYMSXP": number, "LISTSXP": number, "CLOSXP": number, "ENVSXP": number, "PROMSXP": number, "LANGSXP": number, "SPECIALSXP": number, "BUILTINSXP": number, "CHARSXP": number, "LGLSXP": number, "INTSXP": number, "REALSXP": number, "CPLXSXP": number, "STRSXP": number, "DOTSXP": number, "ANYSXP": number, "VECSXP": number, "EXPRSXP": number, "BCODESXP": number, "EXTPTRSXP": number, "WEAKREFSXP": number, "RAWSXP": number, "S4SXP": number, "NEWSXP": number, "FREESXP": number, "FUNSXP": number}

name: createLibR
description: Load libR from appropriate place.

unknown.tagValue: libR object which enables access to dynamic link library.

params.name: r_path
params.description:
"auto" (default) || "environment" || "system" || "buildin" || path to R_HOME
						"auto" - try "environment" -> "system" -> "buildin"
						"environment" - use environmental R_HOME and LD_LIBRARY_PATH. libr-bridge handles nothing.
						"system" - find system installed R
						"buildin" - (NOT IMPLEMENTED) use redistributed binary attached with libr-bridge-bin

return.description: libR object which enables access to dynamic link library.

name: libr-bridge/test/assert_ext.mjs
libr-bridge/test/basic.mjs
libr-bridge/test/unicode.mjs
./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "libr-bridge",
    "version": "0.0.1",
    "description": "Use libR from node.js",
    "main": "index",
    "scripts": {
        "doc": "rm -R doc; ./node_modules/.bin/esdoc; cp ./logo.png doc",
        "jsdoc": "rm -R doc; ./node_modules/.bin/jsdoc -c jsdoc.conf",
        "test": "./node_modules/.bin/mocha --require @std/esm test/*.mjs",
        "debug-test": "DEBUG=libr-bridge:* ./node_modules/.bin/mocha --require @std/esm test/*.mjs",
        "debug-develop": "node --inspect-brk -r @std/esm develop.mjs"
    },
    "author": "kcrt",
    "license": "ISC",
    "dependencies": {
        "@std/esm": "^0",
        "Complex": "^3.0.0",
        "ffi": "https://github.com/kcrt/node-ffi.git",
        "node-gyp": "^3",
        "ref-array": "^1",
        "ref-struct": "^1.1.0"
    },
    "devDependencies": {
        "esdoc": "^1",
        "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1",
        "mocha": "^3"
    }
}
name: package.json
